conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
Based on the preferences provided, I would recommend "The Equalizer" and "End of Watch". 

"The Equalizer" is a crime thriller film directed by David Belle and Stig Larsson. The story revolves around Jack Devlin (played by Jean-Claude Van Damme), a former special forces commando turned private investigator. He gets involved in a case involving several million dollars, which leads to a series of intense action sequences featuring Jack Devlin using his exceptional fighting skills and knowledge of various weapons and tools, including knives, guns, swords, axes, crowbars, whips, ropes, and more, in order to successfully defeat and neutralize or capture the numerous dangerous enemies and criminals and threats that he encounters and faces throughout the course of this intense thrilling action-packed film. 

Stig Larsson is a Swedish author who specializes in crime novels. He was born on December 15, 1942, in Skelleftea, Sweden. He grew up in a rural family, with his father being a farmer. 

He began writing professionally in the early 1970s, and he gained recognition for his first novel, "The Glass Menager" (1973), which was adapted into a popular television series of the same name. He has published over 50 books, including many crime novels, as well as several children's books, non-fiction books, biographies, screenplays, and more.

Stig Larsson died on December 26, 2014, at age 72, in Skelleftea, Sweden. His final book, "The Snowman" (2013), was published posthumously. 

In addition to his literary accomplishments, Stig Larsson is also known for his efforts to promote public health and safety, particularly in the areas of food safety, water quality, and infectious diseases.

The movie follows the story of Anna Foster who moves from her home to New York City to pursue her dreams. However, upon her arrival in New York City, Anna Foster discovers that she has moved into a new apartment building maintained by a young military man named Cleveland Heep. As Anna Foster and Cleveland Heep get to know each other, they discover that both Anna Foster and Cleveland Heep have come from troubled backgrounds and have struggled with personal issues throughout their lives. As a result of these struggles, Anna Foster and Cleveland Heep have often found themselves on opposite sides of various conflicting situations in their lives. Despite the fact that both Anna Foster and Cleveland Heep have always been very much focused on pursuing their own individual dreams and aspirations throughout their lives, they have also always been very much focused on helping others achieve their own individual dreams and aspirations throughout their lives as well.
